p.s: Emended description of the genus Aurantimonas (Denner et al. 2003)
Aurantimonas (Au.ran.ti.moâ€²nas. M.L. adj. aurantiaca orange-coloured; Gr. fem. n. monas a unit; N.L. fem. n. Aurantimonas orange-coloured unicellular organism).
The genus Aurantimonas exhibits the following properties in addition to those given by Denner et al. (2003).
The polar lipids PE [listed in the genus description by Denner et al. (2003)] and SQDG are not detected.
Additionally, two amino lipids are observed.
Isolated from marine environments and does not grow in the absence of NaCl.
The type species is Aurantimonas coralicida.
The genus currently consists of one species, Aurantimonas coralicida.
